de.mrapp.android.adapter.list.sortable

Interface SortableListAdapter<DataType>

  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - The type of the adapter's underlying data
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListAdapter<DataType>, MultipleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, NoChoiceListAdapter<DataType>, SelectableListAdapter<DataType>, SingleChoiceListAdapter<DataType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnableStateListAdapter, AbstractFilterableListAdapter, AbstractItemStateListAdapter, AbstractListAdapter, AbstractSelectableListAdapter, AbstractSortableListAdapter, MultipleChoiceListAdapterImplementation, NoChoiceListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceListAdapterImplementation

    public interface SortableListAdapter<DataType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a sortable list of arbitrary items, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a AbsListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSortingListener(ListSortingListener<DataType> listener)
      Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted.
      Order getOrder()
      Returns the current order of the adapter's items.
      void removeSortingListener(ListSortingListener<DataType> listener)
      Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted, anymore.
      void sort()
      Sorts the adapter's items in an ascending order.
      void sort(java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator)
      Sorts the adapter's items in an ascending order, by using a comparator.
      void sort(Order order)
      Sorts the adapter's items in a specific order.
      void sort(Order order, java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator)
      Sorts the adapter's items in a specific order, by using a comparator.

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        void sort()
        Sorts the adapter's items in an ascending order. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.

      • sort

        void sort(@NonNull
          Order order)
        Sorts the adapter's items in a specific order. If the adapter's underlying data does not implement the interface Comparable a SortingNotSupportedException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • sort

        void sort(@NonNull
          java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator)
        Sorts the adapter's items in an ascending order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null

      • sort

        void sort(@NonNull
          Order order,
          @NonNull
          java.util.Comparator<DataType> comparator)
        Sorts the adapter's items in a specific order, by using a comparator.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which should be used to sort the items, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null
        order - The order, which should be used to sort the items, as a value of the enum Order. The order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • getOrder

        Order getOrder()
        Returns the current order of the adapter's items.
        Returns:
        The current order of the adapter's items as a value of the enum Order or null, if the adapter's items have not been sorted yet or if the adapter's underlying data has been changed since it has been sorted the last time. If not null, the order may either be ASCENDING or DESCENDING

      • addSortingListener

        void addSortingListener(@NonNull
                        ListSortingListener<DataType> listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the class ListSortingListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeSortingListener

        void removeSortingListener(@NonNull
                           ListSortingListener<DataType> listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been sorted, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the class ListSortingListener. The listener may not be null
